adjective, nud·er, nud·est.
naked or unclothed, as person or the body.
without the usual coverings, furnishings, etc.; bare: nude stretch of land laid waste by brush fires.
of photograph, painting, statue, etc. being or prominently displaying representation of the nude human figure.
Law. made without consideration or other legal essential: nude contract.
having the color nude.
SEE MORESEE LESS noun sculpture, painting, etc., of nude human figure.
an unclothed human figure.
the condition of being unclothed: to sleep in the nude.
no longer in common use; now considered offensive light grayish-yellow brown to brownish-pink color.
color that falls within the spectrum of human skin colors.
SEE MORESEE LESS QUIZZES PREPARE FOR HIGH SCHOOL WITH THIS 9TH GRADE VOCAB QUIZ Are you ready to enter high school?
Take this teacher-created 9th grade practice test to see if your vocab makes the grade.
Question of 10 asset expert skill or knowledge; expertness; know-how.
useful and desirable thing or quality.
any covering, coating, enclosure, etc. TAKE THE QUIZ TO FIND OUT Origin of nude 1525–35; Latin nūdus; see naked SYNONYMS FOR nude uncovered, undressed, undraped, exposed.
SEE SYNONYMS FOR nude ON THESAURUS.COM ANTONYMS FOR nude covered.
SEE ANTONYMS FOR nude ON THESAURUS.COM pronunciation note for nude See new.
